The program was permanently reauthorized: health care referrals, and nutrition education for low-income pregnant, breastfeeding, and non-breastfeeding postpartum women, as well as infants and children up to age five who are found to be at nutritional risk.
While the Black Panther Party did launch: there is no evidence to support the claim that they created or operated a program called WIC or that it bore any close resemblance to the USDA program.
